page.title: 08STANTON SHOP
page.content: The village shop at{ {Stanton-upon-Hine-Heath}is the last remaining village shop.There used to be many others until the war but the coming of the motor car has led to their decline.The shop has been there for 80 years. { The shopkeeper buys his goods from cash-and-carry in Shrewsbury.The Post Office is at the left side of the shop and is like a tiny box.Old people come to get their{pensions.}It is very important because the nearest shops are in{Shawbury}.Some people have no transport,so they would protest if it closed. The shop is very {old-fashioned}with {wooden beams,}an old stone-tiled floor and wooden counter.The till is a drawer and customers are served by the shopkeeper himself.He also runs a mini van service.
